p: Additionally, Alzeer et al. [ 49] used various solvents, and the yields of extraction were estimated at 17% (90% ethanol), 20% (80% methanol), 7.4% (acetone), 23% acetic acid, 25% (apple vinegar), 9% (grape vinegar), and 53% (coconut water). Using boiling water (1:10, w/v) and ethanol 96% (1:8, w/v) to elute bioactive compounds from T. polium aerial parts, the yields of extraction were 16.3% and 14.7%, respectively [ 48].
